net.viktorc.pp4j.api

Interface ProcessManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractProcessManager, SimpleProcessManager

    public interface ProcessManager
    An interface that defines methods that allow for the managing of the life cycle of a process. It defines methods that start the process, determine and handle its startup behavior, and allow for its orderly termination. The same instance may be used for the management of multiple subsequent processes, thus the implementation should allow for reusability.
    Author:
    Viktor Csomor

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • start

        Process start()
       throws IOException
        A method that starts a new process. The process created should always be the same and it should always be started only upon the call of this method.
        Returns:
        A new process.
        Throws:
        IOException - If the process cannot be started.

      • startsUpInstantly

        boolean startsUpInstantly()
        A method that denotes whether the process should be considered started up instantly or if it is only started up once a certain output has been printed to its standard out or standard error streams. If it returns true, the process is instantly considered started up and ready as soon as it is running, and the method onStartup(ProcessExecutor) is executed. If it returns false, the method isStartedUp(String, boolean) determines when the process is considered started up.
        Returns:
        Whether the process instantly start up as soon as it is run or if it is started up and ready only when a certain output has been written to one of its output streams.

      • isStartedUp

        boolean isStartedUp(String outputLine,
                    boolean standard)
        Handles the output of the underlying process after it has been started. The return value of the method determines whether the process is to be considered started up and ready for the execution of the method onStartup(ProcessExecutor). It is only ever called if startsUpInstantly() returns false.
        Parameters:
        outputLine - A line of output produced by the process.
        standard - Whether this line has been output to the standard out or the standard error stream.
        Returns:
        Whether the process is to be considered started up.

      • getEncoding

        default Charset getEncoding()
        Returns the character set to use to communicate with the managed process through its standard streams. By default, it returns the platform-default character set.
        Returns:
        The character set to use when reading from and writing to the process' streams.

      • getKeepAliveTime

        default long getKeepAliveTime()
        Determines the duration of continuous idleness after which the process is to be terminated. The process is considered idle if it is started up and not processing a submission. If it returns 0 or less, the life span of the process is not limited. By default, it returns 0.
        Returns:
        The number of milliseconds of idleness after which the process is to be terminated.

      • onStartup

        default void onStartup(ProcessExecutor executor)
        A method called right after the process is started. Its main purpose is to allow for startup activities such as the execution of commands. The executor should be available and ready for processing submissions within this call back, thus its ProcessExecutor.execute(Submission) method should always return true unless the process is terminated before executor could finish processing the submission.
        Parameters:
        executor - The ProcessExecutor instance in which the process is executed. It serves as a handle for sending commands to the underlying process after the startup if needed.

      • terminateGracefully

        default boolean terminateGracefully(ProcessExecutor executor)
        A method called to terminate the process. It allows for an opportunity to execute commands to close resources or to exit the process in an orderly way. The executor should be available and ready for processing submissions within this call back, thus its ProcessExecutor.execute(Submission) method should always return true unless the process is terminated before executor could finish processing the submission. The return value of the method denotes whether the process was successfully terminated. If orderly termination fails, or for any other reason this method returns false, the process is killed forcibly. If the return value is true, the process is considered successfully terminated. By default, it returns false.
        Parameters:
        executor - The ProcessExecutor instance in which the process is executed. It serves as a handle for sending commands to the underlying process to terminate it in an orderly way.
        Returns:
        Whether the process has been successfully terminated.

      • onTermination

        default void onTermination(int resultCode,
                           long lifeTime)
        A method called after the process terminates. Its main purpose is to allow for wrap-up activities.
        Parameters:
        resultCode - The return code of the terminated process.
        lifeTime - The life time of the process in milliseconds.
